title: The Thomas Crown Affair
description: A very rich and successful playboy amuses himself by stealing artwork, but may have met his match in a seductive detective.

reviews.text: The Thomas Crown Affair proves to be a decent movie with a slick, confident performance from Russo, and an even slicker, more confident performance from Brosnan. The story is interesting, and the chemistry between the two leads is top-notch.
Brilliant! Definitely better than the first, gripping right from the start. Loved it.

Pierce Brosnan and René Russo in absolute top form! A heist-movie that is one of the great paragons for the also brilliant Ocean's-movies. And, of course, one that doesn't have to hide behind them. Awesome!!!
The world didn't need a remake of The Thomas Crown Affair. We didn't need it, but we got it anyway -- and it's absolutely positively absuredly terrific.

This was easily MCTiernan's worst film.  Rene Russo was horribly miscast, the music was awful and overbearing, the ending was wrought with cliches and the majority of the film suffers from cheesiness.  It is a cringeworthy experience.

This is one of the best remakes I've ever watched.  It's been too long since I watched the original but this movie stands on its own with powerful performances from both lead actors.  And the score is brilliant as well.
